document.masterDocTitle: Revision of New World Leptocera Olivier (Diptera, Sphaeroceridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of New World Leptocera Olivier (Diptera, Sphaeroceridae)

bibRefCitation.author: Richards, O. W.
bibRefCitation.refString: Richards, O. W. (1931) Sphaeroceridae (Borboridae). Diptera of Patagonia and south Chile, based mainly on material in the British Museum (Natural History), 6 (2), 62 - 84.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Leptocera ( Leptocera ) neocurvinervis
Richards, 1931: 74
( holotype ♂ , BMNH, examined).

Leptocera neocurvinervis
.—
Roháček et al ., 2001: 155
(World catalog).

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Body length 2.0– 3.8 mm . A predominantly dark brown species with very few paler areas: anterior part of frons, inner surface of pedicel and basomedial area of first flagellomere often with reddish tone; mid trochanter, knees, apices of tibiae, as well as mid and hind tarsi paler than adjacent areas. Arista pubescence of medium length ( Fig. 5 ). Palpus slender. Mid tibia ( Fig. 16 ) with bristle above distal dorsal about 0.4–0.6x as long as distal anterodorsal bristle; lowermost bristle of proximal posterodorsal series usually at least as long as lowermost bristle of anterodorsal series; posteroapical bristles short with ventral one up to twice as long as dorsal one.

Type material .
Holotype ♂ and 2 ♂♂ paratypes ( BMNH ): CHILE , Reg. Los Lagos, Chiloé I. , Ancud ,
17–19.xii.1926
, F. & M. Edwards. Other paratypes (all BMNH ): CHILE . Reg. Aconcagua : 1 ♂ , Los Andes ,
1–2.i.1927
, F. & M. Edwards. Reg. Los Lagos: 1 ♂ , Chiloé I. , Castro ,
20–22.xi.1926
, F. & M. Edwards ; 1 ♂ , Prov. Llanquihue , Peulla ,
12–13.xii.1926
, F. & M. Edwards ; 1 ♂ , 1 ♀ , Puerto Varas ,
16.xii.1926
, F. & M. Edwards ; 1 ♀ , Osorno ,
25.xii.1926
, F. & M. Edwards. ARGENTINA . Prov. Río Negro : 1 ♂ , Bariloche ,
28–30.xi.1926
, F. & M. Edwards. 6 ♂♂ and 4 ♀♀ paratypes mentioned by Richards (1931) were not examined. They are from the same localities as the ones examined except for 1 ♂ from Ensenada , Chile.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 87–93 .
Leptocera neocurvinervis
(Chile). Male terminalia (phallus and postgonites omitted): (87) lateral; (88) posterior; (89) ventral; (90) sternite 5. Female terminalia: (91) dorsal; (92) spermathecae; (93) ventral. da—desclerotized area, lp—lamellate process of cercus, proc—tooth-like process at base of posterior section of surstylus, sa—shining area of tergite 7.

Distribution .
Leptocera neocurvinervis
ranges farther south than any other species in the genus. It has been recorded from Coquimbo Region in Chile and Neuquén Province in Argentina south to Tierra del Fuego at altitudes below 1,600 m . Through most of its range
L. neocurvinervis
appears to be the only native species of
Leptocera
(the occurrence of
L. caenosa
in this area is probably due to introduction). The ranges of
L. argentinica
sp.n. and of the rare
L. longilimbata
sp.n. ( Coquimbo Region , Chile ) slightly overlap that of
L. neocurvinervis
but
L. longilimbata
sp.n. occurs at significantly higher elevations (above 2,300 m ).

Discussion . This species shows several unique characters and character combinations. The male possesses a transparent, lamellate medial process to the cercus (but no finger-like process present in many other species), and a pale, microtrichose medial area of sternite 5 (similar area in
L. mendozana
bare). The female has nearly smooth spermathecae (similar to
L. aequilimbata
which lacks the shining areas of tergite 7 present in most species).
